website_summaries.verdict: The Dell UltraSharp 27 4K USB-C Monitor (U2720Q) is a color-accurate 27-inch 4K display with good ergonomics, a solid port selection, and a slightly steep price tag.
pros: Supports height, tilt, swivel, and pivot adjustment

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs and great value
customer_reviews.text: My last Dell monitor served me well for many years before it expired. I am very happy with this replacement and expect it to serve me well for years too. The picture image is ultra-sharp, as the name suggests and the screen is more matted than the screen on my last monitor, so it is easier on the eyes and has less glare. I love, too, that the stand allows me to swivel the screen, perfect for reading and writing of long documents.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Adams

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous - worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous 4K monitor that I use with my i7 PC and with my XBox One S and PS4 Pro. Amazing picture quality, rich and vibrant colours. I have configured one of the pre-sets to switch HDR on and off - On for PS4 Pro/XBox One S gaming and Off for Windows tasks (otherwise your picture will look washed out). This is a great looking monitor with very thin bezels and a great stand that is height adjustable, tiltable and rotates. Comes complete with a three-year warranty from Dell. If you like nice stuff, this is the 4K HDR monitor to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: paulbrad

customer_reviews.title: Be wary with Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor from Amazon and the invoice showed that it was a third party seller who provided the monitor. Warranty I discovered was registered to the third party seller at the time they purchased the monitor consequently I have lost almost a month of warranty. I am in the process of trying to change this with Dell but be warned about purchasing electrical goods via third party sellers on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M Bottomley

customer_reviews.title: Own a Mac with Retina Display? This will disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: If you own a MacBook with retina display and you are looking for a second monitor to work on. This monitor will disappoint you. It's ok for watching YouTube, but for writing documents, doing work on social media such as Twitter, LinkedIn, it's a very average monitor at a fairly high'ish price. Text is not very sharp, neither are images. I am disappointed in it and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Burakiosaurus

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out If You Are Wall Mounting
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Dell monitor. The picture is stunning and I am more than happy with it. One thing to note if you plan to wall mount. There is a 100mm x 100mm VESA attachment on the monitor but is recessed into where the stand bracket fixes. Because the 4 screws are recessed you cannot just take mounting bars of the back of your existing monitor and screw them straight to the back of this one. I now have to spend time and expense to find another bracket which will fit. All the other monitors I have owned have had flush fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Kev Farthing

customer_reviews.title: strong back light bleeding, and red corners
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, it's a great monitor. super sharp resolution and great design. It's an edge lit panel, so there's always going to be some amount of backlight bleed. If you are in a dark room or you're watching dark scenes (movies/videogames) you are going to notice the bleeding more, and the bottom corners can even turn red-ish.. at that point it's up to you if you find it acceptable. Despite the backlight bleeding, the picture quality is great (especially when displaying bright colorful images).
customer_reviews.author: Piergiorgio Niero

customer_reviews.title: Great Mac monitor, not great for films - too much light bleed!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen. Works flawlessly with iPad Pro and Macbook Pro. Excellent for work and as a desktop monitor (that’s what it is!) Many will want to use this for gaming too as it has HDMI, Display Port and USB C AV inputs. 4K is great on this screen but beware if you like watching films, anything with a border (16:9) will highlight the significant backlight bleed at the four corners of the screen. It is distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. A. Macdougall

customer_reviews.title: UltraSharp: well named
customer_reviews.text: I find this monitor absolutely brilliant. First of all, assembly was extremely easy, no tools required, very ingenious. It pivots and tilts very smoothly. And the image quality is stunning. I had a decent monitor with eyecare, but the sharpness was not good enough. This monitor is really very sharp and everything - text, pictures, gaming - is clearer, brighter and neater. What a difference! It is quite long and not too high, which I love (the ratio can vary in 27 inch monitors) and I can easily see two applications side by side which is great. I no longer have to have two monitors, I'm not moving my head so much, it's much better. Happy bunny.
customer_reviews.author: MLR

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: As desktop monitors go, this is fairly expensive. However the expense is fully justified by the performance. The resolution is such that I can only begin to see the pixels with my eyes 6" from the screen - which is closer than anyone would want to look. At normal viewing distance the screen-width is enough to fill the field of normal vision and the colours and colour-balance are as accurate and vivid as I would want them to be. The resolution is fine beyond measure. For single person use it would be difficult to imagine an improvement
customer_reviews.author: Shwnibach

customer_reviews.title: Secondary Home Working Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor for working at home during the recent pandemic. From a brand like Dell and their Ultrasharp range, you expect a high standard and this monitor does not disappoint! I would not recommend this monitor for gaming, however occasional use over standard office task such as Word, Internet, Email etc I think it will suffice. Anyone who knows anything about gaming monitors and is serious wouldn't be buying this anyway... Pretty impressed that Dell were generous enough to include Displayport and HDMI cables when many manufacturers are now leaving these out.
customer_reviews.author: SnowmanPete

customer_reviews.title: Good Monitors
customer_reviews.text: Got a pair of the 25" QHD monitors to replace some 27" 4K monitors from LG which my partner found to be too big. There wasn't much in terms of choice at this size with 4K resolution and now I see why - QHD is more than sufficient at a distance of over 2ft (normal sitting distance while used on a desk). They are being used for software development. The monitors have no defects and the stands make them really flexible, with them rotating in all directions. Only negative is the lack of HDMI cables and the shortness of the supplied cables, but that's a minor thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ascy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant monitor at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Dell monitors for years at work and recently had to buy a monitor for my home set up so naturally went the Dell route. I am using this with my new 13” MacBook Pro and I have to be honest I have been blowen away with how good it is. For everyday use its great and you get crisp clear text on your docs and web browser without any pixelization and I couldn’t be more pleased and have no hesitation in recommending this monitor for anybody wanting a good everyday use monitor whilst also doing a bit of photoshop work and may want to watch the odd movie.
customer_reviews.author: Conolly Gage Esq

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use it for working on text, video calls, and browsing, so can't comment on gaming or photo editing stuff. For what I need it for it's excellent, a massive step up from the circa-£100 monitors - The bezel is thin; 1mm of plastic and 5mm of blank screen on 3 sides - Height/swivel/tilt works well - Build quality is outstanding, as you'd expect for Dell. - USB ports conveniently located on left side and behind - All the inputs you need (HDMI & DP, + DP daisychain). No speakers, but doesn't say it has speakers. If it did they'd be s**t and it'd cost £30 more!
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful monitor from Dell, 8bit panel full rgb cover. and performs good at gaming. if you want 27" monitor go for it. recommended
customer_reviews.author: GBakas

customer_reviews.title: Superlative display.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. 27" and above 4k is really a must. I tried a 1440p in the same size and it looked rubbish. I haven't calibrated it but out of the box photos looked excellent.
customer_reviews.author: bawbag2016

customer_reviews.title: Great Screen
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a good quality screen without spending excessively and I have to say that I am super happy with this purchase. The frame is very thin which gives your a very large screen size. The 24inch display is honestly perfect for me, and wouldn't buy anything larger. The quality of the image is also of very good quality, and works well with my 2019 MacBook Pro 16inch for video editing. The fact that it also adjustable is a big plus for me, and can also be rotated vertically.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: back light bleed is a major problem and the picture quality is not very sharp bought 3 of these and returned them for 3 of the LG 27UL850 and they are 100 times better
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in parts
customer_reviews.text: A bit of a curates egg this one. Stylish design with thin bezel takes up minimum desk space. Overall image quality is good, but 1) too much backlight bleed, not noticeable when in a lit room, but quite noticeable if watching movies in a dim room 2) button on the underside of the bezel are very awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Good sharpness, brightness and resolution. The visible color resolution though is what sets this apart form many other similar monitors. When photo editing/restoring, you can see very subtle color and shading imperfections with this monitor that other monitors just don't seem to have the color fidelity to reveal. Can recommend. Its perhaps a little more expensive than some monitors but you'll see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: cmmr

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: 27" at 1440p is perfect for me and this monitor does not disappoint, exactly like all Dells I have ever used. I had the 24" 1080p version before this one and the colours are improved with the newer model. I have three of these and the contrast/colours are even across them all. Never had a dead pixel with any Dell. There are some comments about backlight bleed on these "Infinity Edge" models, and whilst there definitely is some of that, I don't think that is a particular problem unless viewing a fully dark screen, and when do you ever do that.
customer_reviews.author: Matt, London

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous display with minor niggles
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful display, lovely almost bezel free design, pixel perfect panel and if you set the pixel refresh to the lowest setting it’s good enough for fast gaming too. Gets a 4 star because the construction on mine was a little poor, the button panel on the underside, bottom right is loose and the back panel cover didn’t fit particularly snug. When operating the display buttons they require quite a lot of force which causes the display to tilt so you need two hands to operate them. The stand is excellent, full range of motion and you can rotate the display 90 degrees to a vertical orientation. Display connections are tight so you’ll need thin cables.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant 4K monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 4K monitor I did a lot of research before purchasing this one. I do want two of these. so at some point this year I will be buying another. Picture quality is excellent and plenty of space to work with because of the high resolution. I work in IT and this is perfect for all IT related workloads as you can fit so much on to the screen. Only downside is a little expensive.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect monitor for home working
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, love the different ways you can turn/tilt/higher the screen, to use in either landscape or portrait modes. Current version (Sept 2020) doesn’t come with HDMI lead, but did come with display port lead that I needed anyway. Good price for a very good monitor & stand. With regards the stand, it’s great as hardly takes up any room on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Andy0403

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work laptop connection - adjustable height & screen, eye comfort mode (ComfortView)
customer_reviews.text: I am connecting this with my work laptop. FYI those 2 cables you get - the small blue one is so that the USB will function your hardware (i.e. mouse/keyboard via USB) - otherwise you can only use the USB ports for things like charging your phone. The other one (looks almost like HDMI) I can't use this on my Lenova laptop, however, it is the HDMI alternative. Make sure you have a good HDMI cable lying around as you will need this for connection with regular laptops. Also there are no speakers on this but there is a port for headphones on the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Meets all expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying this monitor. I like the thin bezels and the easy to access brightness settings. No fiddling around wondering what button does what, it is clear as day (comes up on the screen and the buttons are well spaced out). The assemblage was easy, no tools, everything fits in together and feels secure. I really enjoy being able to make the screen portrait and landscape (the usual). It makes working on different types of documents easier and more enjoyable, therefore making me work more efficiently. All in all, no complaints. I like the space grey stand as well it is quite sleek.
customer_reviews.author: Noor

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love...
customer_reviews.text: I have used many screens during my career in video editing however this is hands down the best so far. The screen is MASSIVE and has made me go from having two monitors to one again!?! Baffling I know! The resolution is amazing and even when pixel peeping I didn’t see any massive issue that would effect most tasks. In terms of video editing after sorting out a colour profile this has been amazing, it’s worked really well and I love bing able to see things in so much detail.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor, if a little expensive...
customer_reviews.text: Being used as a second monitor to accompany a Dell U3415W. The colour profiles are a little off, bit given the panel construction is quote different I wasn't expecting them to match perfectly. The OSD is a little limited but all the basic functionality is present. The bezels are super slim all around and I can imagine a pair of them would go very well together.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Brindle

customer_reviews.title: Hopeless customer supper
customer_reviews.text: Delivered without cable. Support page says that Dell offer support. Call Dell. Dell say call Amazon. Go back to Amazon to find support I can write to. Nothing on the order page except support offered by Dell, which it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: AC Otter

customer_reviews.title: Lovely screen to work on
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, and move tilt etc.Found the information a bit lacking. Had to downlaodf a support booklet to find how the OSD worked. Also found another undocumented way to alter the depth of the picture. However, very plaesed with the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: JJJJ

customer_reviews.title: Thin Bezel, not so fast, but good with a newer computer
customer_reviews.text: I have an older MacBook (no USB-C). Connecting the monitor to the display using mini display to HDMI cable caused an issue with slow response times and degraded experience. The monitor is good, provided it's paired with an up to date computer, even a new MacBook Air will do. It wins on not having a powerbrick out of the box. Thin bezel - it'ss amazing how so few companies (LG and Dell as far I can see) make thin bezel monitors. They should have been listening to Apple Keynotes - if they did not have the R&D budget! As Steve Jobs once ssaid, 'you don'y get it, do you?..'
customer_reviews.author: Ken L.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME, but...
customer_reviews.text: The overall feedback is that it's a really great Monitor. Tons of PROs BUT if a I have to find a Cons would be the Only One HDMI port which makes the monitor not suitable for a "fast usage" work/gaming workstation place. Switching cable time by time is not great, being spending such a lot of money. But again, the Monitor itself IS WOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor, idea for pairing with another like that - very narrow bevels makes them perfect for that purpose. The only complain I could have is that it would be great if it had audio speakers. Also, not sure what the small-jack port is doing there as it does not work when connecting headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Dariusz Malinowski

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, slim and very responsive
customer_reviews.text: This is my second DELL monitor. It's well made and very slim compared to my S2719GDF. Compared with the S2719DGF, you can see same colors from all angles. It has DP in and out and that is very important if you intend to daisy chain them. I use it for coding so I can not review gaming or other stuff. Color and resolution is perfect, I do not need more as I work with a Thinkpad T450. I recommend this monitor for general purposes. Note: Install DELL Display Manager from day one, it is an excellent app to manage what you display on your monitors. And don't forget to install DELL drivers too.
customer_reviews.author: Aquanauta

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen, but wrong cords provided to connect Dell screen to Dell laptop
customer_reviews.text: Nice screen, easy to construct. But it loses stars because it fails to make clear what cords it includes - I bought a Dell screen to work with my Dell laptop, but neither of the cords connect to it! There's a DP cable which my Dell laptop doesn't have a port for, and cable for USB upstream port which is useless. It doesn't provide a cable for either of the latop ports - HDMI or Dell Thunderbolt 3.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Made this purchase due to having to work from home. I am familiar with this monitor as s we have throughout my office. I am using it as a 2nd screen along with my laptop. The monitor came in good time, i didn't have to wait long for it to arrive. All in all a great buy
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: A partially broken replacement sold as new
customer_reviews.text: Light, thin, nice design, good screen colours, easy on eyes. My item has arrived with partially broken screen button and has a tiny scratch on screen though despite being packed well. It seems like the item was sent back broken and sold to me.
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: 4k is life-changing
customer_reviews.text: Not a cheap monitor, but the connectivity options are fantastic. I can connect all my desktop accesories to my laptop using the monitor as a USB hub. Picture quality too is fantastic. Using the X-rite i1 I measured decent colour accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this monitor
customer_reviews.text: Modest size on the desk, bright, clear image, no faulty pixels, enough resolution to read small text when showing two A4 documents side by side. Cannot fault it now that I've discovered the menu option that turns on the indicator LED.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Graham Tebby

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice fuss-free design, super thin, but most importantly great display, and doesn't fatigue the eyes. Very good value for a display of this resolution and size. I've used many displays over the years and Dell is consistently good but this is a step up. Tempted to buy a second one at the current price.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, nice clear display. Being able to adjust the height is a nice touch! Can't find anything negative to say about it!
customer_reviews.author: John Rothwell

customer_reviews.title: No HDMI cable
customer_reviews.text: I"d have given this a better review but was irritated (my own fault fro not fully reading the spec of which cables were provided with it) but although it supports HDMI connections to laptops there was no HDMI cable provided. Had I realised I would have ordered one at the same time and been able to enjoy the screen immediately. Still having pinched my sons HDMI cable to make sure everything worked I'd say that the display is fabulous. Its a sleek design and therefore sits unassumingly on my desk. Dual screen works well with my laptop and perfect for work. It might even be good for Netflix!
customer_reviews.author: Louise Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality monitor - with plenty of additional features
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the screen is flawless. No dead pixels. Great refresh rate. Anti-glare surface. Perfect. With the additional USB 3 hub built-in, it's super useful for those using it as a secondary monitor for a laptop. Sit down, plug your laptop in and boom, all your accessories are plugged in too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P

customer_reviews.title: True accurate colour, sharp and bright
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work as my main display to illustrate with Photoshop. The display is super crisp, bright and with true accurate colour at a modest price. The design fits in perfectly with my new Mac Mini 2020
customer_reviews.author: A. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Paying a bit more is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Great 4k monitor, good detail and adjustability with regard to sharpness. Had previously purchased an iiyama monitor which I had to return as it was either too sharp or too soft, no happy medium. But this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jay P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: Looks fantastic. I use it for home-oOffice activities for which it does its job perfectly. Huge improvement over my old ViewSonic HD monitor (although I am sure newer models are equally impressive).
customer_reviews.author: Bluezoo

customer_reviews.title: never thought you could get such good quality
customer_reviews.text: first time having a factory callibrated monitor. amazing! never knew that it could be so good! came in very good packaging and box was done great. worth the money for media content creation or consumption
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ho

customer_reviews.title: Dell Ultrasharp U2719D
customer_reviews.text: Great wide screen monitor. I use it for photo editing and watching video's. Suits my needs just fine. Lots of inputs to suit most situations.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Hayton

customer_reviews.title: I accidentally bought this, and I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.text: I actually meant to buy the 2K version, but ended up buying the 1080p, however this ended up being a perfect secondary monitor (I watch movies/podcasts while working on primary monitor). The stand is also very sturdy, and fully-adjustable. The monitor is great for gaming, however please remember that this is only a 60Hz monitor, so it may not be the best for first person shooters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but faulty from the start, unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Looked to be a superb monitor overall, but connected it to my 2018 Macbook Pro and i3 Mac Mini and the screen was yellow all down the lefthand side. Not a great experience
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture quality and styling
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these at start of lockdown as 2nd screen for laptop and liked it so much i replaced the laptop with a PC and got another one! DisplayPort is great as well, just got an HDMI>DisplayPort cable and now have one of the monitors connected to both PC and Sky Q box so can switch between the two (Sky being HDMI>HDMI).
customer_reviews.author: Martin M

customer_reviews.title: Could be a great monitor if not a substantial IPS glow
customer_reviews.text: Bought it being aware of the risk. IPS glow is very bad with this unit. Only decided to keep it as the most pronounced glow is in the right top corner which is probably the least looked at part of a the screen. The glow also seem to affect the colour uniformity. Disappointed, as it's my 3rd Dell ultrasharp monitor, after 2412m and 2417h with the 2412 being of the best quality so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mikolaj Janez Staszek

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, slow seller
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a non-working display port and have waited over 2 weeks for a refund... Still no message or response. The monitor was good though visually.
customer_reviews.author: Phlo10

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for design with Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Its been about 3 weeks using this monitor now and Im happy with the quality of screen. The native high-resolution is very sharp and colours are perfect for doing design work. The 27" size is much more comfortable designing - or sometimes using half the screen for code, the other half for viewing. I spent a great deal of time comparing monitors and am glad I went for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great screen for visuals
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my work as an interior designer and the resolution is stunning. I'd also recomend because it has a sturdy frame that can be adjusted up and down and because the two USB slots on the side are also veyr handy.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great picture
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a very clear screen to work from home and this has been excellent. I was thinking about 2 smaller screens but this fits the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for working from home
customer_reviews.text: Arrived this morning took 5 minutes to setup if even and worked with my MacBook Pro very quickly. Love the colours and size. A must have for anyone working from home for the foreseeable future for sure. Wouldn't recommend this for anyone who wants to game its purely designed for office and creative professionals
customer_reviews.author: Oisin Brannock

customer_reviews.title: Very sensible
customer_reviews.text: Loving it. A really sensible size and resolution for the money. Would buy again. Great colours and evenness.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Smart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - Home Office
customer_reviews.text: Pro: - great quality - perfect size for a home office - excellent packaging - easy to assemble - adjustable and tilt capabilities Con: - Both USB Ports on monitor do not work - tried with multiple cables and devices
customer_reviews.author: MISS K.

customer_reviews.title: looks great but missing hdmi
customer_reviews.text: Looks great but cant comment on how well it works as it came without the hdmi so I cant actually use it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing; definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality! Great connectivity: I am using this monitor with my MacBook Pro and I managed to set it up so that I only connect the monitor via the USB-C and my keyboard, mouse and another USB device come up at once. A great quality monitor like every other Dell monitor in this range.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Barbu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to upgrade my home setup to three monitors and have been very happy. Excellent display with exactly the right inputs for my home setup and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P

customer_reviews.title: US power cables for UK delivery & HDMI cable missing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two screens and surprisingly both had US power cables and there were no HDMI cables included. One of the box was most likely opened as someone the cables were unwrapped/open. It caused me lot of inconvenience to arrange power adaptor and dig into my old TV power cable to get them working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, quality service
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, arrived before it was expected to as well.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product but UK purchasers beware
customer_reviews.text: This is the U2720Q model so you get the DP -> DP (no mini DP) rather than HDMI -> HDMI cable. It only comes with an IEC -> 2 pin power cable so if you're in the UK you won't be able to use it until you source your own IEC -> 3 pin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great screen
customer_reviews.text: This large screen means I can see more on my desktop. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Owen

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love it! For the price it is an amazing display! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor Shame it doesnt come with an hdmi cable
customer_reviews.author: GBT

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: really like the 1440p picture quality and tiny bezels. Got 2 mainly for working from home
customer_reviews.author: Namster

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful monitor with thin bezels solid stand
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these, connected to my laptop via a docking station.
customer_reviews.author: Horzel

customer_reviews.title: Poor black levels compared to 2017 model
customer_reviews.text: I also have a U2417h model which produces nicer black levels. This monitor looks washed out compared to it. I was dissapointed in the quality difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but planning for this to be the last monitor I buy for years to come. Arrived well protected, no dead pixels. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Daisy-chaining from a MacBook doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Bought to run dual monitors.. Unfortunately Mac>USB-C>U2519HC>DP> U2519H does not work for extended displays, it only mirrors display. Works if plugged in individually so a thunderbolt hub now required (and not cheap!)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Quality monitor
customer_reviews.text: Ideal monitor for programming, browsing and general daily tasks. I have run a couple of games on it, seems great for everything but not for FPS
customer_reviews.author: David Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Very good size, tils and rotates easily, the best monitor I ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great screen and a great picture
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, great price. I upgraded from a five year old model and the difference was night and day. Fantasic picture quality and just the right size without being too big.
